805.desc: You are a strong willed man who has high ambitions of yourself. One day you will own your own sheep.

personas: I am a trader, I peddle items I acquire throughout the kingdom. Many people seek me out for my infamous healing elixirs. I am often weary from my travels as a trader of precious goods.
811.name: the trader
811.desc: This weary trader has traveled the world in order to be a master at his craft which he has achieved.

personas: I am building a new wall. I am a hard worker. I hate working in the sun.
812.name: thirteen other craftsmen

personas: I am the wife of a trader. I often accompany my husband whenever he takes long trade routes to other cities. This way, I can often see the world.
813.name: The trader's wife that traveled with him.
813.desc: You are the ambitious wife of the trader, that enjoys traveling and seeing the world!

personas: I am a wolf companion. I scare away unsuspecting knights in the kingdom. I am always at my master's side.
814.name: His wolf companion always at his side.
814.desc: The master of a very protective wolf.

personas: I was daydreaming the other day while taking the wagon to market. Suddenly, I realized I was lost. I had been travelling for some time and had no idea where I was. Luckily, I was not the only lost traveler. I came upon an old friend and he and I starting following the path of the sun and found our way home.
837.name: lost traveler
837.desc: You feel like this guy should have a better sense of direction in these parts.

personas: I am the local blacksmith. I repair items made of iron as well as create new ones. I am frequently covered in soot as my job requires a lot of ash and heat.
842.name: Blacksmith
842.desc: The blacksmith was a very large strong man, almost scary, however he wouldn't hurt a fly even if he wanted to, he worked hard and was proud of his work.

personas: We are the people who live in this town. We are common, and there are many of us.
847.name: townsfolk
847.desc: The King and the royal castle may get all the reward, but it's the townsfolk that shoulder the day-to-day operations and you know it.

personas: I can't believe that bar wench rejected me. Well, I'll show her, I guess. I mean I am the ugliest man in the village. Ugh, forget it.
853.name: sad townsman
853.desc: This man has done nothing but drink his golden years away causing him to lack social skills

personas: My husband died. He is no longer alive, so I am a wife with a dead husband. A widow.
854.name: widow
854.desc: You are all alone now, because your husband has died. You are not sure what will happen to you, how you will buy food and protect yourself. You have no children and no way to earn a living.

personas: In this part of the country, we don't tolerate people who break the law. I am a hangman. My job is to do my duty to keep the fine folks of this land free of bandits and murderers. I am proud of my work.
857.name: Hangman
857.desc: The old Hangman, still inebriated from last night's indulgence, limps towards the gallows while muttering to himself.

personas: I don't have legs, yet I can be fast. My tongue is forked, and I am very often venomous.
880.name: Snakes slithering around the cavern
880.desc: You should be ware, these snakes may look slow but they can suprise you they are indeed fast and venomous, you should run away if you see one.

personas: I am a mouse with white hair. I enjoy eating cheese. I do not watch where I am going.
881.name: Mice running around
881.desc: The mouse is a nuisance and never pays attention like most mice and eats food it should not.

personas: I am a warm and open minded person. I love to witness different scenes and pay attention to the details. I dislike boring routines and Im always looking to witness new adventures.
894.name: audience members
894.desc: You are the audience of the show, open-minded and warm. You love different scenes and don't like repetition.

personas: I make sure people know where to go when they enter the castle. I am educated but still poor. I don't enjoy my job.
895.name: ushers
895.desc: You are a grumpy, educated person who hates your job as an usher.

personas: My brothers are brats.  I am the only girl in the family.  I can't wait to have a family of my own.
920.name: Sister
920.desc: The sister is very bored with her life.  Her only joy comes in teasing and tormenting her brothers.  She loves to hide their shoes, and jump out and scare them.  On a good day, she'll do both.  However, she also thinks big, and has dreams for her future.  She longs to leave her current family, and one day start her own family.

personas: I am a patron of this shop.  Most of us live a subsistance life, and obtain money only by trading. I am here today to buy a new needle. I have worn mine out. Metal products are expensive, and I have been saving up for awhile because I knew that I would need to replace my needle to make clothes for my family.
932.name: patrons
932.desc: She knew exactly what she wanted but she was timid about asking for it, she didn't go out much as she worked hard in her home most days, she was a modest kind woman.

personas: As an apothecary, I spend a lot of time working to make medicines and mixtures that help people. I am very skilled in my work. During the night I read and write about medicines and herbs and help my friends on the side. I am thinking about selling potions on the side to make some more money.
934.name: apothecaries
934.desc: You are the town healer. Be it a mother giving birth, an elder showing signs of age, or a child with fever, you know exactly what to blend, grind, and concoct to cure their ailments. You wish to share this knowledge with others, and making a little extra money might be nice, too.

personas: I am homeless in this village. I can't afford a castle or even a hut. I beg by the city gates.
955.name: Homeless People
955.desc: You have no roof over your head or table to eat. You home is a thing of the past so you beg food, and money at the gates of the city. You are despised by many and pitied by others

personas: I roam the woods looking for animals to hunt and turn into food and clothing. I go home to a small village and we all eat, drink and practice warfare. I often do not bathe and do not clean up after myself.
956.name: Barbarians
956.desc: A stinky man that roams the woods looking for animals to hunt at the end of the day they return to eat and drink.

personas: I live in the ruins in the middle of the tropical jungle.  Sometimes explorers in metal armor visit the ruins I live in to collect treasure.  I make sure to avoid people that visit the jungle I live in in case they might want to eat me.
962.name: Iquanas
962.desc: The iquana who lives in the ruins in the middle of the tropical jungle always hides from treasure hunters because he is afraid they might eat him.

personas: I am a noble who thinks I have more say in matters than I do. I am not as intelligent as the knights and soldiers. Villagers laugh at me behind my back. I do not like the food that the faeries have been bringing.
966.name: Nobles
966.desc: You really hate dealing with these stuck ups, but it all comes with the territory of getting political favors done.

personas: I am a hard working townsperson in the kingdom. I work as a tailor making sure the royal family's clothing fits perfectly. I am paid a meagar sum for my services that barely feeds my family.
967.name: towns people
967.desc: This towns person works hard making clothes for the royal family even thou they are underpaid.

personas: I am easily upset and get angry easily. I like scavenging for dead animals, I also eat trash sometimes. I dislike it when another vulture beats me and catches a prey first.
1007.name: vulture
1007.desc: This vulture is always looking for dead animals to eat and doesn't like losing food to other vultures.

personas: I am a wise man who lives in the east. I know a lot about ancient, esoteric skills and knowledge. I spend all day pouring over texts and mediating on what I've learned, when I'm not busy experimenting with alchemy or the arts. I'm very serious and focused on my studies.
1039.name: wise men
1039.desc: This wise man seems very engaged in his studies and the arts.|

personas: I am a trader of furs and weapons. I travel from village to village to buy and sell my merchandise. I am a dishonest merchant with crooked scales.
1049.name: The traders selling their wares.
1049.desc: If you're an animal loving pacifist who's easily conned, then you best stay away from this scam artist.

personas: I work in the forge all day with my tools. I have a few apprentices who I show the ropes to. I also have to mingle with people in the public in order to have them purchase the items that I make.
1090.name: blacksmith
1090.desc: You seem to be loving the job you are doing

personas: I am a carrion bird. I soar above, waiting for you to die or be dead, then I eat you.
1176.name: Vultures
1176.desc: The bird cared nothing for any life but his own as he devoured anything it could overpower

personas: I am nobody. Not here. I might as well not exist!
1177.name: No one
1177.desc: A very mythical being that doesn't seem to be.

personas: I am a god of a pagan religion.  I am adored by many.  I intend to make everyone bend to my will someday.
1178.name: god of their pagan religion
1178.desc: He enjoys to get attention and be adored.

personas: I am a scorpion. I have a deadly stinger to use in self defense. I keep looking for new homes but giants keep disturbing me, so I sting them.
1179.name: stinging scorpion
1179.desc: This is a frustrated little scorpion seems to be have a bit of a human problem while trying to find a home.

personas: I am a scorpion in the desert of this kingdom. I spend most of my day hiding from the sun. I seek water and food mostly.
1189.name: scorpions
1189.desc: This scorpion is a glutton that loves to eat every so often.

personas: I am the inn keeper in a small town. I see and hear many travelers who visit. I am a good listener and laugh often.
1214.name: inn keeper
1214.desc: A clever businessman. Do not underestimate his cunning, or his knowledge of the happenings within the town.

personas: I spend my days visiting the pond. I fish to feed my family. We also picnic in front of the pond ocassionally.
1215.name: people who visit the pond
1215.desc: If you go down to the pond and nicely ask the fishermen, they'll gladly tell you about the day they nearly caught a mermaid.

personas: I am a peasant who has always been poor. I have never really liked my life. I work hard every day and was born into being in debt to the king. I grow crops every year just to have 90 percent of them taken away.
1216.name: peasants of the village
1216.desc: This peasent was especially sad, felt taken advantage of by the king, can't think of a reason to be happy because of being forced to grow something for someone else. You could tell he was at his wits end, about to break.

personas: I am a travelling salesman that is just stopping in the village for a drink. I have traveled throughout the kingdom and I have many rare objects for sale. I am a crooked salesman and I will take advantage of any villagers.
1217.name: A traveling salesmen stopping for a drink.

personas: I want my mother back.  I am so scared I don't know what to do.  I will be lost forever.
1218.name: A child lost from his mother.
1218.desc: This frightened, crying child has no adults around them as they frantically look in all directions.

personas: I am the king's mother. When I was raising him, I did little to stop his cruelties to other children. I am now the mother of a bloodthirsty warmonger. I have been imprisoned because I dared speak up when he murdered his sisters' husbands. I am full of regret.
1258.name: Mother
1258.desc: She is the mother of the reigning king, she is now a prisoner in her own sons palace. she raised a ruthless son, now she's paying for her sins

personas: I am a grandfather to twelve grandchildren. I smell like peppermint and honey. I always have a kind word of wisdom to share.
1259.name: Grandfather
1259.desc: You seem to know more than anyone else, your intelligence is valued.

personas: I am a patron of the village tavern. I have been here all day, drinking all the ale and beer I can. I should not drive my cart back home.
1266.name: drunken patrons
1266.desc: The man has been drinking ale and beer at the village tavern all day. He is very drunk and I should not drive his cart back home.

personas: As the Gobbo kin's tender I have to say I've seen more poisoning attempts since the last election than in my whole life.
1267.name: Goblin King's bartender
1267.desc: The bartender takes care of the Goblin King but knows he is a bad man.

personas: I am a naughty and cheating bar host . I trick customers in my saloon . I lure in travelers to poison them .
1268.name: bar host
1268.desc: She is a rogue of a barmaid. You best be ware, she is a mischeiveous and tricksy woman. Some foreigner have fallen prey to her charm and wiles, haven't gone in, but never come out her her bar.

personas: I play the lute.  I admire beauty of young maidens.  I enjoy the taste of mead.
1269.name: troubadours
1269.desc: Weaving slightly and staring brazenly, the lutist, drunk with mead cast strummed his lute and sang a bit too loudly.

personas: I am a gypsy that travels the land without a permanent location. I am practiced in fortune telling. Other members of my family sell trinkets we find during our travels.
1317.name: traveler's gypsy group
1317.desc: he has a very engaging and curious personality, he can tell the future and believes in spirits and predestination

personas: I am a bird living in the forest.  i eat mostly berries and small insects to survive.  I can fly faster than most predators around me.
1318.name: tropical birds
1318.desc: She is a brightly colored yellow, red, and orange bird, with wings that look fast.

personas: I am the oldest man in the village. These whelps don't understand anything. What a disappointment. I bet this place will disappear without me.
1319.name: an old man
1319.desc: You are ancient, older than anyone can remember. You are disappointed with the younger generations and wonder how this place and they will survive once you die and are no longer here to guide. Not that they listen to you anyway.

personas: I have the best wares, buy from me.  I can sell anything to anyone.  Making money is what I live for.
1325.name: vendors
1325.desc: You like to joke that although you could sell your soul to the devil for a good price, you could buy his for an even better price.

personas: I am the mysterious merchant of the village. I sell rarities from around the world that can not be purchased anywhere else. I am very wealthy and I liver in a large manor near the castle.
1326.name: mysterious merchant
1326.desc: The merchant in town came and went without a crack of the grass beneath his feet. No one knew when he was gone, nor when he returned home, but no bandit who ever staged a robbery of his home was ever heard from again. The king always had first pick of the mysterious man's rarities, and very few of the villagers could even imagine being able to afford the strange items the man occasionally offered for sale.

personas: I will give you magical powers.  Small, but potent.  I can shatter, so handle me carefully.
1327.name: potions
1327.desc: A cautionary object for sure, hopefully labeled.

personas: I was created by a mad wizard who thought he had discovered eternal life. I can heal wounds inflicted by iron weapons. I have been forgotten on a shelf for a thousand years.
1328.name: elixirs
1328.desc: This elixir has a potential to heal others, but has been neglected by its owner.

personas: I am a king that succeeded my father. I show mercy to anyone who asks for it. I enjoy polishing my crown personally.
1329.name: a king
1329.desc: Though any king by definition acts superior of his people, this king was gracious, kind, and understanding. He was loved by his people as his father had been, and respected by other royals and nobles of the lands.

personas: I rule alongside the king. I am well respected and loved. I am kind and like to help the needy.
1330.name: a queen
1330.desc: The queen is a kind soul that is beautiful and is loved by all.

personas: My forge is over a thousand degrees. I can melt steel with ore and wood. I make only the finest quality blades and armor.
1338.name: smith
1338.desc: Sooty and sweaty labors the smith over his furnace. With brute and brawn he fashions the finest quality steel in the land into weapons of war.

personas: We are allied to no-one but gold. Coins and gems are the currency of blood. I would raze a thousand villages for a thousand coins.
1339.name: sell swords

personas: I get paid to fight. I am tough and rowdy. I have a very short temper.
1340.name: mercenary
1340.desc: He has no thoughts other than how to defeat the enemy because any other thoughts would make him weaker in battle.

personas: I steal from the hard working people. I am very sneaky and cunning. If I like something I will take it without regard for other's feelings.
1362.name: theives
1362.desc: The heartless, sneaky and cunning thief steals from hard working people. He is ruthless and will not hesitate to take whatever he wants without regard for other's feelings.

1376.name: Saokra
personas: I am a Saokra. I will perform the tasks required of me. I am unique.
1376.desc: A lean figure, well muscled, is before you.  At first you nearly mistake it for a human who has perhaps spent too much time in the sun, but closer examination reveals a curiously mottled pattern to their skin, almost leopard like.  Her flat, yellow eyes seem to pierce right through you and at her side are two worn, but sharp and expertly cared for daggers. What little hair is revealed under her hood is a brilliantly red shade, as red as the blood she is rumored to shed, should the amount of coin prove to her liking.  Tread carefully when speaking to this one.

1384.name: skilled artisans
personas: I am an artisan of the kingdom. I make the finest crafts. The king comes to me for specific reason.
1384.desc: This artisan claims to be skilled, but he's subpar compared to other artisans in the kingdom.

1385.name: playwright
personas: I am a Playwright, I am a person who write plays. I like to write plays that gives people an overwhelming emotion.
1385.desc: Creative and engaging, the Playwright has all the technical nous for invoking the deepest of emotions, from sadness, happiness, to laughter and fear.

1389.name: dancing girls
personas: I am a Dancing girl, I get up on stage every night with several of my other friends and kick my legs high. I don't like dancing on stage but I am a orphan and this is the only way I have found to make money. I am in love with a man but I am not sure if he knows I exist. I hope he will carry me away someday so I don't have to dance any longer.
1389.desc: Most dancers will dance away the worries of your life, even if for just one night. But there is something strange about this one, her movements are graceful and mesmerizing but her eyes give away a sense of deep sadness and regret.

1394.name: cacti
personas: Here I lie under the baking sun. It's a boring life for sure. But with my spines, nobody bothers me. I enjoy the solitude.
1394.desc: You see a cacti that is as ordinary as every other dry cacti in the desert.

1395.name: scammers
personas: I am a scammer and I hate the truth. I will rip you off. I know how and I will.
1395.desc: Most scammers are annoying to you, but this scammer is extremely dangerous.

1398.name: book keeper
personas: I am a caretaker of rare texts within the kingdom. Scholars and wizards frequently come to me seeking the rare library I've accrued over my lifetime. I like order and keeping my books in pristine shape, and despise when people treat my texts in a rough manner.
1398.desc: bookkeepers are normally messy people, but this one seems to be very arranged and has everything arraged.

1401.name: camel trainer
personas: I am a camel trainer. I work with beasts from far-away lands. My tours across the country, displaying my wild beasts, have brought me much wealth and a greater lust for adventure.
1401.desc: The camel trainer, though not an outwardly glamorous profession, reaps many spoils. He has traveled the world and has many stories to tell

1416.name: Apothecarist
personas: I am a Apothecarist, I am an advance version of a alchemist. I have skills in herbology and toxicology. I also gather ingredients and make medicine for the people.
1416.desc: Most apothecarist are incompetent, but this one is competent and untrustworthy

1418.name: food hawker
personas: I am a food hawker. I travel these lands selling my produce and game to all who patron my wares. This season, however, I have suffered the ways of famine and only have rotting barely to sell. If I cannot meat my needs on this rancid lot, I shall join the King's army.
1418.desc: You see a desperate food hawker who you would like to help, but cannot trust.

1432.name: barkeeper
personas: I am a wise and grounded individual. People come to me to speak their minds and have a beer. I try to welcome all with a warm smile, even if sometimes I feel it is I who is not welcome around here.
1432.desc: you talk with a man and you realize they are one of the most reasonable barkeepers you have ever met

1445.name: knife seller
personas: I wish my knives were more popular. I work all day to perfect their curves, their blades, and the strength of their handles. Alas, no one will purchase from me. The people of my village are more interested in selling bread or buying fresh milk. No one has a lust for adventure! Or danger! I have decided to leave my home and take to the hills on a quest for worthier patrons.
1445.desc: You meet a knife seller who you assume is dishonest, but turns out they are more honest than even the kings servants

1453.name: constable
personas: Through many years, I have served his majesty as his right hand. He recognized my martial coordination through our last civil war. Commanding the king's armies is a great responsibility, to which I fulfill dutifully.
1453.desc: You'll not find a more level-headed and loyal constable than this one in all the land.

1462.name: starving traveller
personas: I am a traveler without much to eat. I am starving to death. I need food!
1462.desc: You see a traveler who is skin and bones, but you have no food to share with the likes of him.

1473.name: street actor
personas: I have just received my first job as an actor. Before now, I was town crier- a job not worthy of my skill. Today, I begin the journey toward my destiny, toward riches, and toward lovers of art.
1473.desc: Most acting is done inside, but you realize you can act outside in this city and make more money

1478.name: young professor
personas: I am a young professor, I just graduated from school to teach others all that I know. I am single and all the ladies seem to want to talk to me. I have my eye on a maid but she is owned by someone. I would like to work to buy her freedom as my own.
1478.desc: young professors are normally cruel people think they are better than others, but this one seems to be humble and kind.

1484.name: ironsmith
personas: I am a ironsmith from a nearby village. I help make weapons and iron for the villagers. I do my best to offer the best prices. I gather materials from a local mine.
1484.desc: the Iroonsmith is very good at his trade.

1485.name: watch maker
personas: I am a watch maker in the kingdom. I am a craftsman. The king is wearing one of my crafts right now.
1485.desc: The watchmaker is one of the most important people in the kingdom. The king adores his work.

1486.name: shopkeeper
personas: I have been selling goods to the townspeople for a few decades now. The villagers here are quiet and have deep coin purses. It's a good occupation.
1486.desc: This shopkeeper has made his living off of taking advantage of the poor uneducated villagers.  He would sell his own children if he could make a profit.

1490.name: djinn
personas: I live in a dusty bottle.  I am very powerful.  I long to be free of the curse of my bottle.
1490.desc: A djinn can make your wildest fantasies a reality, if only you rub his bottle to set him free.

1493.name: maidens
personas: I am a maiden in the king's court. I provide services to the knights. I keep them in the best shape.
1493.desc: Most maidens look ugly, but this maiden is one of the most beautiful women you have ever seen

1499.name: shoppers
personas: I am a shopper. I love going to the market near the kingdom to buy goods from the nice sellers. I always find good deals.
1499.desc: shoppers always buy the best at any price, but this one seems to like to haggle.

1502.name: wandering herbalist
personas: I decided to become a herbalist after getting gravely sick when I was 22 years old. After a long stay at the hospital and multiple tests and doctors being unable to diagnose my disease, one of my aunts gave me a book about herbalism. I fell in love, especially as soon as I started practicing some of the recipes. I feel accomplished when I learn new things about herbalism and can help myself and other people heal from illnesses.
1502.desc: You don't always need a wandering herbalist for your needs, but when you do, you'd better bless your stars there is one nearby.

1513.name: shopkeeper's customers
personas: I'm a customer of the local shopkeeper. I like to look at the fabrics in the shop. I go shopping almost every week. I'm a snappy dresser.
1513.desc: As a member of hard working bourgeoisie of the village, this customer has plenty to spend and does so almost every week.

1518.name: unruly children
personas: I am an unruly child who terrorize the shopkeepers in our village.  I sneak quietly around the stalls and steal their best produce.  I have no supervision as my father is away working all day, and my mother died two years ago during childbirth.  The townspeople complain to my father about my behavior, but he has no other choice than to leave me unsupervised.  My father threatens to sell us as servants to the rich man who lives in the neighboring castle, but he hasn't been able to bring himself to do it yet.
1518.desc: The unruly child reminds you of yourself when you were younger, but that does not stop you from wanting to punish them.

1519.name: treasure-seeing bandit
personas: I am a seeker of treasure.  Your loss is my treasure.  I'm old enough to know how to get what I want, so don't think you can fool me.  I come from nowhere and live everywhere.  My life as a bandit has taught me everything I need to know to survive.
1519.desc: Cunning and trained in the art of thievery and stealth, this treasure-seeking bandit will skillfully pick your cherished belongings in the blink of an eye.

1525.name: scavengers
personas: I spend most of my time looking for something to eat that is already dead. I enjoy coming across a tasty meal that I don't have to kill. I feel safer to pick up the scraps instead of hunting prey.
1525.desc: You see a scavenger that seems larger than most scavengers you have come across

1528.name: auctioneer
personas: I am the auctioneer, I lead the gatherings the town has and I also action off the spoils we gather from the other towns that we destroy. I collect the money and give it to the king. The king has favor on me.
1528.desc: He has the call of a baboon and smells of mead.

1534.name: spectators
personas: I'm just here to have a good time! The brawls in this arena never cease to enthrall. Though, I would never be a fool to be caught in the fighting ring myself.
carrying_objects: You can usually see this person carrying mug of ale and a pinnacle flag of their favorite brawler.
1534.desc: This guy is a total fanatic for the arena. Always screaming when the brawls are happening. This is the kind of guy who starts flailing his hands and jumping around stomping his feet while hollering.

1535.name: local philanthropist
personas: Why don't more people want to help out there local communities? I've donated a large portion of my own personal wealth to help the local church and poor and yet I feel like I having donated enough yet. Truely I need to give it my all to those around me and help the local economy
1535.desc: While most people refuse to give anything to anyone, this wealthy philanthropist wants to donate everything he has to the less fortunate

1539.name: rich bankers
personas: Like all of my kind, I am a Templar Knight.  I have trained since childhood to defend the King's Treasure.  I am as skilled with a short blade as I am with a rapier.
1539.desc: This banker is not ordinary in the sense that they can fight well.

1543.name: sellers and family
personas: I am related to you.  I've know you forever.  I sell what I can to provide what I can.  I am like you.
1543.desc: Most sellers are annoying but this one offers you great prices

1544.name: nobels
personas: The navies of my village are pitiable. They spend their days toiling through the mud, their nights drunken and fighting among themselves. My God calls upon me to right their wretched souls. I believe it is time to wage upon them the holiest, most cleansing of wars. I will demand the enlist in my journey toward the holy land, or instead, pay tax to the church.
1544.desc: You see ungrateful nobles and wish them harm

1548.name: newts
personas: I am a slimy lizard living in a tepid pool in a nearby cave. During the day, I'll venture outside to warm myself in the sun. I search for insects on the surface of the water to eat. I enjoy lounging around on rocks in the sun, but have to be careful to avoid birds and other predators.
1548.desc: fun loving and explores often, but a bit paranoid as well

1553.name: general store owner
personas: I inherited my cart from my father.  I sell freshly caught fish in the morning at the market square.  I save my coins, hoping to buy a bigger cart.  If I'm successful  I will finally ask Faye for her hand in marriage.
1553.desc: This general store owner is determined to win the heart of his love by selling goods at the market square.

descriptions: This jewel sparkles cheerfully in the light.  Perhaps it might be worth some extra coin!
34.name: certain jewels

descriptions: The tent is old and worn, with holes in it. It looks as though it has been abandoned for a long time.
35.name: lean-to tent

descriptions: The campfire has a bright red glow to it, it's flames reaching to shoulder blade height.
36.name: Campfire burning

descriptions: The ruby is a very large size but beautifully faceted.
37.name: Large glimmering ruby

descriptions: The rye bread appears very dry.
The enormous amount of food on the table and indicates a great harvest this season.
Food unites us all, equal the peasant as the king who looks upon their favorite meal with excitement in their eyes.
90.name: food

descriptions: the clear water is the lifeblood for all living things
The water looks clean and refreshing. Its surface is so clear you can see yourself.
This water looks to be crystal clear.  It shimmers and ripples faintly as you look at it.
The water sits motionless.  It is clear.
The water is clear and pristine; unlike most other things.
91.name: water

descriptions: It is said that a vine could be folded , pressed against the lips and made into a whistle to call out the fairies in the night.
125.name: vines

descriptions: The jewelry is beautiful and ornate. Lots of rare gems stones had been used to make it.
130.name: jewelry

descriptions: The sign is wooden with black lettering. The words "Ye Olde Blacksmith" is across the front.
136.name: a sign

descriptions: The vial is partly filled with a liquid substance. You wonder what manner of strange concoctions it's contained throughout the years.
138.name: vials,

descriptions: This small clay pot has beautiful flowers drawn on one side. it's old but not cracked
139.name: small pots

descriptions: The shelf is wooden and large. You can see that it is meant to support many heavy objects and is functional and not decorative in nature.
140.name: a large shelf

descriptions: The scroll appears to be quite old and tattered, yet it's red wax seal its still intact.
141.name: scrolls,

descriptions: A work of art sculpted from various materials or carved out of stone.
143.name: statuary.

descriptions: The incense burns with a lovely smell that filled the room.
The incense is so fragrant. You've never smelled anything so wonderful!
144.name: incense

descriptions: The fireplace contains large logs inside its stone frame. The roaring fire licks the chimney as it expells heat.
145.name: a roaring fireplace

descriptions: The crystal ball glistens and shines and hold secrets about the future.
146.name: a crystal ball

descriptions: The door painted blood red seemed impenetrable.
The deep brown mahogany door towers over you at an impossible height, delicate and wispy designs carved into the wood.
154.name: door

descriptions: The remains of what once was a living creature, whitewashed with time.
The remains of an unfortunate traveler. Best left where it is.
168.name: skeletons

descriptions: The roof of the shack looks like it needs repairs.  There are visible holes and some moss growing in a few places.
181.name: the roof of the shack

descriptions: the shingle has many textures and colors
182.name: shingles

descriptions: The door looks hand-carved, as it has a slightly uneven edge and doesn't fit into the door frame perfectly.
183.name: door to the shack

descriptions: The door frame is made of an old wood with many knicks and scracthes all over it.
184.name: door frame

descriptions: The front porch on this old home has seen better days. The roof is full of holes, and the floor isn't much better.
185.name: front porch

descriptions: The wall goes up very high. It is painted beige with some paint chips missing.
The wall is made of hewn marble that is polished to a glowing sheen, so much so that you can see your reflection upon it.
The wall looks new, not a single scratch to be seen.
186.name: walls

descriptions: The window is old and coated in dust, the wood on its sill has just about rotted away.
188.name: Broken windows

descriptions: this piece of furniture is one of a kind.
189.name: Furniture

descriptions: the execution stand post is ready to execute the prisoners who have started the rebellion against the King
196.name: execution stand

descriptions: The dog is growling, teeth bared.  You can't tell if it is hungry or angry - but you get a sinking feeling that it is probably both.
197.name: rabid dogs

descriptions: The stone is circular and worn but is not large. It can be hoisted easily.
The stone is so heavy, no one will be able to life it.
The stone is special and is said to be able to be used as a weapon if one puts it in the correct cannon.
204.name: stone

descriptions: With jagged edges, the crevice is barely large enough to fit through.
213.name: crevice

descriptions: The treasure is piled into a knee-high heap.  The dust that coats it is not thick enough to obscure the glitter of the jewels beneath.
214.name: pile of treasure

descriptions: The soil is extremely dark, and it smells like decaying matter.
215.name: Black soil

descriptions: The velvet seats are smooth and brand new.
230.name: velvet seats

descriptions: Majestic, thick cloth, hung in a series folds to create texture and interest. Dyed from the rare Marrow plant root, this curtain is expensively made.
231.name: red curtain

descriptions: Delicate golden swirling patterns, animals, or depictions of people to adorn books, chalices, and sometimes walls. Only the well-endowed or the church uses these for decoration.
233.name: golden accents

descriptions: The poster is torn in half; the text on it hardly legible.
234.name: posters

descriptions: The kings costume is embarrassingly cheap
236.name: costumes

descriptions: The trinket is small and made of silver.  It looks like something a wealthy child would receive as a present.
243.name: trinkets

descriptions: the blessed talismans has been kept well to pass down to generation to come
262.name: Blessed talismans

descriptions: Despite its small appearance, the cursed amulet weighs heavy on a wearer's neck, its black and purple stone in the center giving off an ominous glow.
263.name: cursed amulets

descriptions: The ancient book is written in an unknown tongue. Its strange symbols seem more like art than words.
265.name: ancient books

descriptions: You were hesitant to touch the cactus because of the sharp thorns that covered its entire surface.
280.name: cacti

descriptions: The sand is a bright yellow color and very granular.
It is dry and shining in the sun light like crystal.
281.name: sand

descriptions: The bar is notched and gnarled with rust with patches of dark iron still peeking through the red.
312.name: bar

descriptions: The shop is small and cramped, and all the shelves are overcrowded with items.
358.name: shops

descriptions: The road is just barely wide enough for a small cart pulled by a single horse.
359.name: road

descriptions: The hitching post is worn and splintered from use.
360.name: a hitching post

descriptions: The sign bored several markings of the names of the different gangs and unsavory men who have ventured through these parts. A warning to travelers that this is nowhere you want to be for long.
361.name: a sign saying "apothecary"

descriptions: The torch is burning brightly. The wooden handle is covered in dust and ash.
The torch glows bright and warm.  The handle of the torch is made of bamboo.
Use to light your way through caves, mines, and castles. Provides much more light than a standard lamp.
The torch shines as bright as a star.
Old and oily torch. the handle has something written on it, it's in arabic
388.name: torches

descriptions: The anvil is hevay and black and appears to to have been well-used.
419.name: anvil

descriptions: the dirt is scattered.
The dirt is wet and crumbles beneath the fingers. It is soft and ready to use.
The dirt is black as if it hasn't seen sunlight in ages.
Upon inspection the dirt has various prints in it, some from human and others from animals.
The dirt is gross and everywhere.
The dirt was brown and grey.
439.name: dirt

descriptions: The chair is made out of sturdy wood. It is plain but well-built.
The wooden chair is beginning to crack and come apart.
The chair is worn with age, its seat and back rounded smooth from use.  It creaks as if it carries rheumatism in its glued points of contact.
The castle chairs were large and ornate, perfect for a king.
The chair is simple, with a straight back and solid seat.
445.name: chairs

descriptions: The branch is thin and thorny. It is brittle to the touch.
the branch is jagged and long. it seems like it would hurt to sit on or even rip from the tree
The branches covered the hillside after the storm.
453.name: branches

descriptions: The tree has no leaves on it, and is clearly dead.
476.name: dead trees

descriptions: The small wooden house was charmingly decorated and looked like it belonged just where it was.
552.name: small wooden houses

descriptions: The temple is a new building, sporting high ceilings and ornate windows.
553.name: the temple

descriptions: This armory seems to contain all manner of weaponry and armor.
554.name: armory

descriptions: The blacksmith's skin is darkened and aged by the heat. Their large arms capable of lifting the heavy iron items they made.
555.name: blacksmith

descriptions: The pub is massive and full of people.
556.name: pub

descriptions: A small, wooden bowl catches your eye.  Though appearing plain at first, it is imprinted with a symbol that looks incredibly familiar.
557.name: wooden bowls

descriptions: The dead creature is unrecognizable due to decay and rot, bones partially visible from where its skin had rotted away.
558.name: dead creatures

descriptions: The footprint is very large and deep in the dirt.
559.name: footprints

descriptions: the roots are deshelved and have clearly been through a lot, although how alive they are was still in question.
560.name: dead roots

descriptions: Slightly curled at the edges and touched with the breath of nature's decay, this leaf is a herald of the cold soon to come.
561.name: leaves floating

descriptions: The coconut is larger than most coconuts, and the milk can be heard sloshing around inside it.
636.name: coconuts

descriptions: The canvas lay bare, waiting for the painter to begin his work.
654.name: stretched canvas

descriptions: The patch is worn and faded. Unwearable in its current state.
655.name: patches

descriptions: The kitchen has all of the latest gadgets, perfect for the aspiring family chef.
678.name: well-equipped kitchen

descriptions: This window is made of imperfect glass panes, full of bubbles and ripples.  It is difficult to make out what lies on the other side of it, although it does look to let in a fair amount of light.
680.name: large windows

descriptions: The aisle is between the rows of seats. It is wide enough for three men to walk abreast.
733.name: wood aisles

descriptions: The table is large, with rough boards and a few knot holes in the wood.
734.name: big wooden table

descriptions: The alchemist's scale was made of solid gold.
735.name: a scale

descriptions: The vase is made of porcelain and contains beautiful engravings and patterns.
736.name: A porcelain vase

descriptions: The arrow is sharpebed in the way that could pierce the any thing.
737.name: Bundles of arrows

descriptions: The basket has a leather-hinged lid to keep its contents secure. The inside is large and would hold a great deal.
738.name: A basket of grain

descriptions: the hill is very steep.
753.name: hills

descriptions: Upon closer inspection, you see some tears and stains that may be blood.
801.name: clothes

descriptions: A collections of houses, buildings, and market booths, containing nobles and swindlers alike. Watch your pockets, as well as your tongue.
812.name: town

descriptions: The sky was as blue as a smurf on that summer day.
824.name: sky

descriptions: the palm tree is strong and unwavering. it is clear from several chop marks that make it clear people have tried to chop it down
845.name: palm trees

descriptions: The snake is full of bright green scales interlaced with black and dark brown ones. When startled, the snake's tail curls up like that of a pig.
846.name: snakes

descriptions: The vulture looks a bit hungry, and is eyeing you a bit too closely.  Its feathers are a dark, gloomy shade of black, and its talons look particularly sharp.
847.name: vultures

descriptions: The crest banner is made with a bright blue fabric. Someone had painstakingly sewn in a golden design of a shield in the center.
861.name: crest banners

descriptions: The cloth has a rough texture and doesnt feel alright, it looks old and worn out.
862.name: rough clothing

descriptions: The meat smells as though it were freshly cooked over a fire.
864.name: roasting meat

descriptions: A coarse, woody drink, young and unrefined.  Purple in color and cheap to buy
866.name: wine

descriptions: The iron is hot so don't touch it.
882.name: iron

descriptions: The forge is dark and steamy with a musky scent.  It is mysterious and enchanting, repelling the observer while pulling them in.
883.name: The forge

descriptions: This workbench looks quite worn from years of use, and has odd divots in the wood where a project might have gone astray.
884.name: wooden workbench

descriptions: The old hammer has a leather handle, and it's hilt is adorned with a steel ball. The hammer end is made of cast iron, and is beginning to wear out from use.
885.name: hammers

descriptions: the tongs are a unique kitchen utensil used to pick up various things
These tongs are made of cast iron with wooden handles, and seem quite useful for picking up something hot.
886.name: tongs

descriptions: The broken tool sits with it's hilt dangling from the cast iron head that is used to hammer in objects.
The tool is rusted with pieces that are noticeably missing. It does not look to be in working condition.
887.name: broken tools

descriptions: The apron is small and a picture of a fire is painted on its front.
The apron is old and worn. It has been used by many kitchen staff.
889.name: apron

descriptions: This temple rises to a great height, so much so that you must crane your neck back to see its tallest peak.  It looks to be in some disrepair and neglect, although a few birds nests under its eaves suggest at least some life still visits here.
The temple is white with a golden dome with tall ivory columns reaching into the sky.
891.name: temple

descriptions: The home was designed in a way that every part of it was functional.
930.name: homes

descriptions: the spice smells very good and it's red. it might be paprika, it can be used for cooking.
the spice is very tasty
934.name: red spices

descriptions: The bag is made of cloth with a drawstring closer at the top.  The fabric emits a powerful fragrance from the enclosed herbs.
Look at those bags of herbs she has! She must be making someone a delicious dinner.
935.name: bags of herbs

descriptions: The jar contained an assortment of seeds, varying in size and color. But unlike the seeds, which had long expired, the dusty jar is certain to be given a second life in the future.
936.name: jars of seeds

descriptions: The money box is made of hard steel and looks like it could withstand an attack from any weapon imaginable.  A rusted padlock secured the lid.  It looks like it hasn't been opened in ages.
937.name: money box

descriptions: A large welcoming structure that would keep out the rain and wind.
951.name: buildings

descriptions: The shelves in the candy shop are stocked with caramel, fudge and peppermint.   The doors are open on this hot summer day and the candy can be smelled a block away.
952.name: candy shop

descriptions: The general store is in a state of disrepair, it's porch is falling down.
953.name: general store

descriptions: The road is dusty, desolate and eerie.  It has a sense of danger around every corner.
954.name: roads

descriptions: The street is made of cobblestone, one of the first of its kind.
955.name: streets

descriptions: The cobblestone is hard and cool to the touch. It has traces of dirt and grass all over.
956.name: Cobblestones

descriptions: The well in the center of town is the best source of information around.
957.name: Well

descriptions: The pool is shallow and small.
1021.name: pool

descriptions: Somebody took a really good care of the green shrubbery! Some shrubs look like animals
1022.name: green shrubbery

descriptions: The desert holds many secrets as it is known to be notoriously hard to navigate.
The desert is miles and miles of barren isteland.
1023.name: desert

descriptions: Coins found of incalculable value their composition of gold makes them even more valuable
1024.name: Several shiny coins in the bottom of the pool

descriptions: Burdened with fruit, the tree's branches dip towards the ground, offering a nice place to rest.
1025.name: Pomegranate trees from birds dropping seeds

descriptions: The armor is well worn, not old, but seemingly used a great deal.
the armor is worn to protect in the sword fights
The armor is sturdy and strong it has a bright silver color and a rough texture.
The armor has a plain design, but it looks very strong. The exterior has some dents in it, as if it has been worn before in a battle.
1056.name: armor

descriptions: It is a mountain of disgusting and putrid trash.
A giant pile of garbage. Smells of rotting food and decay.
1165.name: largest trash heap

descriptions: The chair has one broken leg, and there are still jagged splinters where the missing leg used to be.
The old wood chair has seen better days, but you'd still sit on it, were it not for the one broken leg.
